topics.definition: Activity of purchasing goods from stores.
Place where goods are bought and sold, usually outdoors.
topics.example: They visit the farmers' market every weekend.

topics.definition: Retail establishment selling items to the public.
topics.example: He works at a grocery store.

topics.definition: Large building or series of connected buildings containing retail stores.
topics.example: They went shopping at the mall.

topics.definition: Owner or manager of a store.
Person who buys goods or services from a store or business.
topics.example: She thanked the customer for their purchase.
He made a purchase at the electronics store.

topics.definition: Place in a store where customers pay for their purchases.
topics.example: They waited in line at the checkout.

topics.definition: Reduction in price of an item.
topics.example: The store offered a 50% discount on selected items.

topics.definition: Item bought for less than its usual price.
topics.example: She found a great bargain on shoes.

topics.text: Sarah and Emily went shopping at the local market. They visited different stalls selling fresh produce, handmade crafts, and clothing. Sarah found a beautiful scarf at a bargain price. Emily bought fresh vegetables for dinner and chatted with the friendly shopkeepers. They enjoyed their time at the market and planned to return next weekend.

topics.definition: To shop continuously until you are exhausted.
topics.example: They went shopping in the city and shopped till they dropped.

topics.definition: To engage in commerce by purchasing and then reselling goods.
topics.example: They buy and sell antiques as a hobby.
